remarks: The GLB of a set of lattice elements ` S ` is the same as that of the set ` T ` with elements of ` S ` cut down to be under ` W ` . (Contributed by NM, 19-Mar-2014.)  (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
dihglblem.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
dihglblem.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
dihglblem.m $e |- ./\ = ( meet ` K ) $.
dihglblem.g $e |- G = ( glb ` K ) $.
dihglblem.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dihglblem.t $e |- T = { u e. B | E. v e. S u = ( v ./\ W ) } $.
dihglblem2N $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ S C_ B /\ ( G ` S ) .<_ W ) -> ( G ` S ) = ( G ` T ) ) $.
$d ./\ u v $.
$d B u $.
$d S u v $.
$d W u v $.
